fact_check_explanation_title: Marcus Rashford did not tweet this at Katie Hopkins
fact_check_explanation_summary: The footballer did not reply when she tweeted at him.

fact_check_explanation_title: This is what has happened with student nurses who volunteered to work for the NHS early
fact_check_explanation_summary: Final year nursing students were asked to start being paid to work for the NHS early, but now that is ending.

fact_check_explanation_title: No, the government is not proposing to inject the public with tracking microchips
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson did not write a letter asking the public for their thoughts on mandatory RFID microchips.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson overstates number of schools with returning students
fact_check_explanation_summary: Boris Johnson was wrong to say that 97% of primary schools which report data had kids coming back. The figure on the day he was speaking was 69%.

fact_check_explanation_title: No evidence to back up these claims about fluoride
fact_check_explanation_summary: Fluoride is added to toothpaste and water to help prevent tooth decay. The only potential negative effect of fluoride at levels recommended in the UK is teeth discolouration.

fact_check_explanation_title: Public transport use higher than transport minister claimed
fact_check_explanation_summary: Grant Shapps claimed use of public transport is at 5% of its usual levels, but government figures show it is actually much higher.

fact_check_explanation_title: Boris Johnson incorrect to say Keir Starmer is “completely wrong” about past trends in child poverty
fact_check_explanation_summary: Mr Starmer said 600,000 more children are in poverty than in 2012, which is correct according to government data on children in low income households.

fact_check_explanation_title: A Norwegian-British research paper doesn’t claim the virus causing Covid-19 was man-made
fact_check_explanation_summary: There is still no evidence to suggest that the new coronavirus was man-made.

fact_check_explanation_title: Some children with no recourse to public funds are eligible for free school meals
fact_check_explanation_summary: A question at PMQs by Labour MP Stephen Timms suggested this wasn’t the case. Free school meal eligibility has been temporarily extended to some of these children.

fact_check_explanation_title: The Covid-19 track and trace app has not been automatically downloaded onto people’s phones
fact_check_explanation_summary: “COVID-19 exposure notifications” is not an app—it is an API that can work with tracing apps if they are downloaded.

fact_check_explanation_title: What did lockdown rules say when these Labour MPs are claimed to have broken them?
fact_check_explanation_summary: These Labour MPs have either apologised for or defended their actions during lockdown.

fact_check_explanation_title: Yes, patients were discharged to care homes without Covid-19 tests
fact_check_explanation_summary: Until 15 April there was no requirement to test patients being discharged from hospitals to care homes for Covid-19 in England.
